job_title: Anonymous in White Plains, NY
pros: Hands down one of the most rewarding career experiences I’ve ever had. Unfortunately I realized that the toll it was taking on my physically and emotionally just wasn’t something I could sustain, but I have a lot of friends who still work here and I think they’re literal earth angels for all that they do.
cons: I realized I didn’t have what it takes to stay in a career in the medical field. It’s not easy and it doesn’t get easier and that can be a really defeating thing to realize.

job_title: AR/Insurance Denials Specialist in White Plains, NY
pros: has some great benefits, such as health insurance, dental and matching for your 403b.
cons: Management is terrible and HR is even worse, useless and not helpful towards employees

review_title: A lot of positives to working here
job_title: Medical Assistant in White Plains, NY
pros: Growing hospital with astronomical opportunities for professional development. They have the resources to deliver top-quality care. Managers were receptive to feedback. In fact, they encouraged us to share our thoughts.
cons: Obviously, being a medical assistant comes with a ton of responsibility. You must be willing to take accountability if you make a mistake.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in White Plains, NY
pros: I liked that my managers were clear about what they wanted; it took a ton of stress out of an already intense job. I also liked that they were willing to work with us. You don’t see that a lot in the medical setting.
cons: Some of my coworkers were immature, so I avoided working with them as much as I could.

job_title: Physician's Assistant in White Plains, NY
pros: Working with physicians who genuinely cared about their patients made the job an enjoyable and educational experience.
cons: Management demanded excellence 100% of the time.

job_title: Nursing Technician in White Plains, NY
pros: White Plains Hospital overall was a great place to work!
cons: The staff was often short

review_title: Do yourself a favor and just apply
job_title: Anonymous in White Plains, NY
pros: Honestly? Do yourself a favor and apply. If you’re thinking about working here just send out an application because it’s always better to know for sure than to live with any “what ifs” You’re probably applying to other hospitals too so why not just give yourself more options, apply, and go with what feels right?
cons: At the end of the day I have no complaints about this organization or anything about my time there. It was an incredible learning experience and I’m grateful.

job_title: Anonymous in White Plains, NY
pros: I hate review sites like these because at the end of the day everyone is going to have a different perspective on things, because everyone is different. My advice? Work here for yourself and make up your own mind about whether or not you like it instead of feeding into the narratives other people want to spoon feed you.
cons: I’ve said my peace and that’s all I have to say.

job_title: Internship in White Plains, NY
pros: Everyone was welcoming and friendly, and it helped prepare me for my future career in healthcare
cons: I don’t have anything to add to this section

job_title: Anonymous in White Plains, NY
pros: Really great leadership who know how to run a hospital and how to lead by example. There’s no dictators at White Plains, which is great for morale. Because of their example, everyone is friendly to each other and that makes for a much nicer work environment.
cons: The only thing I would say would be a con is the pay you start out with.

job_title: Anonymous in White Plains, NY
pros: White Plains is one of the top hospitals in the state.
cons: The environment is extremely fast paced. If you work here, make sure you get enough sleep and take time for yourself to avoid feeling burned out!

job_title: Anonymous in White Plains, NY

Your coworkers are mostly amazing.
No union. No union fees. 
Pays well
cons:
Management is utterly incompetent. ALL of The nurse managers couldn’t start an IV….

1:20 pt nurse ratio (I had 33pts a few times) 
The hours are not flexible. 
They don’t move you from nights & days unless they like you. 
High employee turnover 
Poor employee retention
Parking is horrible for staff
Dangerous waiting room as violence may occur.
The ED techs mostly are lazy & incompetent, so get used to doing everything yourself anyway.

review_title: Nursing Technician at White Plains Hospital Center
job_title: Nurse Technician in White Plains, NY
pros: As a part-timer you have benefits including but not limited to tuition reimbursement, sick/vacation/holidays, 403B Pension plan and disability. Parking is cheap. ($16 a month average). Magnet Hospital (Looks good on your resume). Supportive of students and employees pursuing higher education.
cons: Small community hospital. Pay is not really competitive. No Union unless you work for housekeeping or Unit Clerks. Evening and weekend staffing needs improvement. Some units have high turnover rates.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in White Plains, NY
pros: Consistent hours and great benefits are all a wonderful benefit to working at WPH. The hospital has also undertaken a major initiative to take care of the health of their employees. This includes healthy meal options, within the cafeteria, at very reasonable prices for employees.
cons: Unfortunately, the culture here at WPH is not very accepting of new employees. Senior members use intimidation as a way of accomplishing a task. While one would expect teamwork to be present, there is much disunity among health professionals. Unless you are a physician, do not expect to be treated with much respect.

job_title: Nurse Technician in White Plains, NY
pros: Management seemed to genuinely care about staff and encouraged growth and learning. Decent salary. Opportunities for continuing education available. Appreciation for all levels of staffing.
cons: Seemed to be a stepping stone for many employees-- a lot of people would start here and leave after a year to go to a larger hospital.

job_title: Medical Assistant in White Plains, NY
pros: Good benefits and semi-okay employee appreciation.
cons: Pay is very low. Yearly increase is terrible and they start pay off low even with a bachelors with 5 year experience. They don’t promote within unless favored by someone important. Lack the ability to utilize employee knowledge and degrees for growth.

review_title: Met lots of great coworkers during this time.
job_title: Registered Nurse in White Plains, NY
pros: Close knit staff from every department.
cons: Company contributions to 403b aren’t yours unless you stay for three years, you’ll want to leave before than because of the lack of support from management. Little opportunity to move up unless you have parents that work in the facility, then you’ll be considered for positions with barely any experience. RN to PT ratios can go up to 1:8 on some days.

review_title: Great environment, good leadership, very good salary
job_title: Patient Transporter in White Plains, NY
pros:
1. Very good salary
2. Management is flexible, really works with employees schedules, although as an employee we need to make sure we reciprocate the same attitude!
3. Departments have a high morale, this is a great environment.
4. The hiring process was the best I have ever seen, anywhere.  (HR & Occupational Health A+!)
cons: Can't think of any, whatever problems occur, management is always helpful in resolving.

review_title: Working at WPH was overall a great experience. A lot of it had to do with the people you work with.
